definition: experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: Does it mean that a sophisticated man has a high EQ?
sentences.chinese: 这是否意味着老于世故的人拥有较高的情商？

sentences.english: She's a very sophisticated young woman.
sentences.chinese: 她是个老于世故的年轻女子。

sentences.english: She tried to cultivate an air of sophistication.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力养成一种老于世故的气派。

sentences.english: The sophisticated school doctor had a sour temper.
sentences.chinese: 那个老于世故的校医脾气很坏。

sentences.english: Can be seen as manipulative. Offloads personal work.
sentences.chinese: 看起来老于世故，卸除个人工作。
他现在已变得老于世故了。

definition: variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
subtle way of thinking (idiom); hard to fathom/deep and shrewd
